item.title: The two-sided hypocrisy
item.description: An easy way to get your point across is by pointing out hypocritical elements of your opponents. Such argument is not necessarily fallicious, because an inconsistent position is a wrong position. But often, these alleged hypocritical elements are about the supporters of a cause and not the position itself. One particular rhetorical device, however, is when the allged hypocrisy can easily be flipped around to allege hypocrisy in the opposite side by the same style.
